Ah my apologies Phil. Will put SPOILER ALERT in the future. LOL! Ah
when it gets to be this early in the morning, one should sleep so
she remembers things like these. ^__~

messages.subject: Re: Serizawa Kamo fanart rated: PG
messages.msgSnippet: Just a teenys-weensy reminder that if you re going to talk about things that happen in shows/manga/anime, etc., you should provide a spoiler warning for those
messages.messageBody:
Just a teenys-weensy reminder that if you're going to talk about
things that happen in shows/manga/anime, etc., you should provide a
spoiler warning for those who haven't seen or read it yet. I, for
instance, haven't seen the episodes of NHK's "Shinsengumi!" before
Itou's arrival in Kyoto. ^_^

phil

messages.subject: Re: Serizawa Kamo fanart rated: PG
messages.msgSnippet: I definitely agree. Theirs was a very unique relationship, not the fluffy kind or the shy type. It was a nice breath of fresh air in my opinion. It was funny
messages.messageBody:
I definitely agree. Theirs was a very unique relationship, not the
fluffy kind or the shy type. It was a nice breath of fresh air in my
opinion. It was funny how they understood each other and showed it
in not so -normal- ways. I mean who says she doesn't know what will
happen to her after she dies? And her knight in shining armor comes
along and says join me. LOL! While I re-watched that I got
goosebumps.

Oh Sec... Saitou was there overhearing the conversation. I'm not
sure if it's just me but... I have this nagging feeling that SK was
saying that not only for Oume but for Saitou to hear it (hopefully
to fulfil that wish)? Wasn't it at that point that SK already knew
he would be dying soon, which is why he was so open to Oume about
it? LOL!

>

Yume).

messages.subject: Serizawa Kamo fanart rated: PG
messages.msgSnippet: I think the most fascinating pair in NHK s SHINSENGUMI! was by far Serizawa and Oume. Wasn t it romantic when she asked where she would be buried? The Wild
messages.messageBody:
I think the most fascinating pair in NHK's SHINSENGUMI!
was by far Serizawa and Oume.

Wasn't it romantic when she asked where she would be buried?
The Wild Duck said "join me in my grave".

That was sweet!

Ok, maybe not.

But still I think they were very dynamic (sort of like Shishio and Yume).

rated PG
http://1happyturtle.com/temporary/Serizawafanart.jpg
[click to see full size]

Kizu captured that very scene in her music vid
http://www.hajimenokizu.com/misc.htm
